sub_title: Adaptive Design & Artwork Manager EMEA at AkzoNobel
summary:
As manager Creative Teams and Projects I’ve built, coached, managed and trained well-organized, multidisciplinary, professional teams from scratch and managed complex packaging artwork and labelling launches with great results. I successfully initiated and implemented efficient and improved ways of working, locally and international. I gained my knowledge working on both client as agency side. I’m experienced in leading and mentoring Artwork-operators, designers and project coordinators in cross-functional and international teams. As a person who connects stakeholders I’m constantly negotiating and managing relationships. I'm proactive with  a 'can-do' mentality, I take the lead when needed and I don't walk away from my responsibilities.
I’m appreciated by colleagues and described as result driven, pragmatic with a can-do mentality, a high sense of responsibility and excellent organizational sensitivity.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you're interested in my help. I'm always available to discuss the possibilities.
Mobile: +31 (0)6 29 437 850 | Mail: keesvanlier66@gmail.com

Specialty: 
stakeholder management ● creative project management ● packaging & labelling project management ● team management ● coaching/mentoring ● cross functional leadership ● international artwork management ● print production ● design & print management ● continuous improvement ● change management ● studio management ● traffic management ● troubleshooting ● quality control

education.field_of_study: Effectief Communiceren en Leidinggeven voor het midden management

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: 
Integrate Adaptive packaging design and artwork management to have a robust, efficient and flawless end-to-end artwork process. Manage the artwork management process of the ca. 8.000 jobs and ca. 300+ competing projects annually with stakeholders at Marketing, design and repro houses and ca. 20 pack and print suppliers in the region. Manage the central artwork management team of 9 artwork-, print-, & pack coordinators across Europe. Drive continuous process improvements working closely with the business and various stakeholders to reduce total artwork costs (ca. €2,6 Mio annually) and reduce the speed to market.
Key words: First Time Right, cheaper, faster and consistent. Work area: Europe & Africa and Global.

Results:
Efficient and robust end-to-end artwork management process from adaptive design to print ready artwork with first time right briefing and first time right artwork.

Deliverables:
Continuous improvement of the Adaptive packaging design model and the artwork management process.
Clear artwork management guidelines implemented in the Business Unit DECO EMEA. Colour accuracy for our printed packs.

Brands: 
All Flourish Consumer brands (e.g. Dulux, Flexa, Levi’s, Dulux Valentine), Dulux Trade, Sikkens, all Woodcare brands.
profile_positions.title: Adaptive Design & Artwork Manager EMEA

profile_positions.description:
1 year assignement and part of Global Marketing Decorative Paints.

Responsibilities:	
Develop and implement a new and mandated adaptive packaging design model 
to ensure an efficient global end-to-end adaptive packaging design process. 
Key words: cheaper, faster and consistent. Work area: global.
Single Point of Contact for the graphical design process for contracted parties. 

Results:
Cost saving of €2.7 million (60%) and speed to market reduced with 60%. 

Deliverables:
• Development and execution of the process and training materials 
  including an e-learning model and supporting tools. 
• Realized roll-out in the BU’s E&A and SESAME. 
  BU’s LATAM and CHINA in preparation.

Brands: 
All Flourish Consumer brands, Dulux Trade, Sikkens, all Woodcare brands.
profile_positions.title: Global Project Manager Graphical Packaging Design

profile_positions.description:
Interim support on Packaging & Labelling Artwork Management & New Product Introductions. Seconded by YACHT, assigned to GSK Pharmaceuticals Regulatory Affairs Europe. 

Responsibilities:
• Manage and coordinate the end-to-end Packaging & Labelling Artwork process.
• Initiate artwork changes
• Continuous improvement of the artwork quality and process.
• Reviewing current way of working and advice on improvement for sustainable future.
• Stakeholder management.

Deliverables:
Implementation and training plan for the improvement of the artwork management process. This complete plan will be implemented by the artwork coordinator and the RA team lead.

Project Falsified Medicine Directive:
A mandatory serialization of all medicinal products distributed in European. 
This is to ensure patients receive the actual medicine and to avoid counterfeiting.
After February 2019 pharmaceutical products without serialisation are not allowed in European markets.

Brands: Seroxat, Ventolin, Zovirax, Seretide, DuoFilm, Flixotide.
profile_positions.title: Senior Packaging Artwork Specialist a.i.

profile_positions.description:
GSK Consumer Healthcare is an international fast moving consumer healthcare company.

Responsibilities:
• Build a multicultural, cross functional Artwork Management team.
• Management of a cross boundary team of 8 artwork coordinators, 
  (6 in Hamburg, 1 in Copenhagen en 1 in Munich).
• Complete resource, capacity, budget and capability planning.
• Quality control and continuous improvement of the artworks and processes.
• Stakeholder management.
• Coordination of the end-to-end packaging artwork production process for
   North & West Europe (Benelux, Scandinavia and DACH). 
• Coordination of 1800 artworks changes per year for 11 countries in 10 languages.

My goal to improve the quality and the artwork process was met by successfully developing and implementing a new artwork management model with an annual cost saving of over € 600.000. This model is now the blue print for the Global artwork organization and as a result we implemented a Global packaging artwork management.

This is an international role with stakeholders in Denmark, Germany (Area HQ), England (HQ) and India (artwork production) and frequent travel within Europe (35% of my time). I have daily contact with agencies, pre-press companies, printers and sites from Europe to Asia.

Brands:
Sensodyne, Proglasur, Aquafresh, Parodontax, Corega, Panadol, NiQuitin, Breathe Right.
profile_positions.title: Artwork Manager North & West Europe

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
• Professionalizing packaging artwork management.
• Set up packaging artwork management team for marketing Oral Health.
• Managing and coordination packaging artwork projects; Creation and Production.
  (artwork for components as tubes, cartons, leaflets, Sachets etc.).
• Continuous improvement of the artwork quality and process.
• Stakeholder management.
• Coordination of the end-to-end packaging artwork production process for Oral Health in North & West Europe (Benelux, Scandinavia and DACH). 
• Initiate artwork for changes and new designs/products at artwork providers.
profile_positions.title: Artwork Manager Oral Health | North & West Europe

profile_positions.description:
After successful introduced of new artwork management system in all European markets in 2011 we are now facing phase 2: the Global deployment of the PASS (Packaging Artwork Shared Services) workflow. 

Project goal:
By the end of 2012 all Consumer Healthcare packaging artwork globally will be handled via PASS.

Responsibilities in Global project:
• Report into the Global Deployment team.
• Stakeholder management.
• Implement new packaging artwork project management system to international markets and sites. 
• Coordinate and facilitate training for the new system.
profile_positions.title: Global Market and Site training coordinator | Packaging Artwork Shared Services

profile_positions.description:
Luminus Communicatie was an enthusiastic and ambitious agency with 25 employees.

Responsibilities
• Manage a Studio of 7 (Mac-Operators and designers)
• Budget, capacity and resource planning.	
• Continuous improvement of the quality and process of studio production.
• Studio capability and project planning.
• Member of agency leadership team.
• Brand guardian and quality control on studio output.
• Develop and implement a certified PDF workflow.
• DTP and Repro activities.

Clients:	
Montèl, PostCode Loterij, BankGiro Loterij, DTZ Zadelhoff, Douwe Egberts (Sara Lee), Sharp, Technische Unie, ProRail, Nationale Bioscoop Bon.
profile_positions.title: Studio manager

profile_positions.description:
cayenne communications bv was an international advertising agency with roughly 50 employees from 13 different countries and nationalities.

Responsibilities:
• Management of 3 departments, Studio, Production and Art-buy.
• Manage and coach 15 employees.
• Resource, capacity and budget planning.
• Continuous improvement of the quality and process of agency production.
• Ensure a good and smooth cooperation between all departments
  (Account, Creation, Studio, Art-buy and Production).
• Advise on and support repro and print productions.
• Develop and implement a project management workflow and an image bank.
• Stakeholder management and training.

Clients:
Canon, NBTC, Kawasaki, UPC and Skoda for international ATL and BTL campaigns.
